Hey <@U059AC59LLF> regarding "Address Autofill for Checkout" we need you to complete some requirements before we begin development.

*Requirements*
‚Ä¢ We need the Google Maps API with the Places API enabled. (<https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/get-api-key|How to get Google Maps API Key>) 
‚Ä¢ Additionally, the client can easily grant us access by following the instructions below:
    ‚ó¶ 1. Navigate to the <https://console.cloud.google.com/projectselector2/home/dashboard?_ga=2.154698232.1161219785.1713436967-508255439.1713099900|project selector> in Google Cloud and create a new project for Stacked Marketer if you don't already have one. Make sure to attach a billing account to this project. (<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uINleRduCWM|How to create and attach a billing account to a Google Cloud Platform project>)
    ‚ó¶ 2. Go to the IAM (Identity and Access Management) section and click on the "Grant Access" button.
    ‚ó¶ 3. In the principals field, add `<mailto:dev@refact.co|dev@refact.co>`. Set the role to "*Editor*" and then click the "Save" button.

I will be installing MonsterInsights Pro on our production website to test its reporting for MemberPress (SM Pro). I want to see how this works in real time.

It shouldn‚Äôt cause issues, it basically grabs data from Google Analytics and adjusts Google Analytics settings to track revenue, products, etc.

In other words, *it shouldn‚Äôt affect any of the frontend or even backend of the website itself.*

The only way for me to see if it delivers the data we want is to have it live in production unfortunately.

Will let you know if I need any help.

Hi everyone, it seems we still have that issue with accessing content even though someone has signed up and has an active subscripton.

The user this happened for: EricThom70

‚ÄúI attempted to move forward in the eCommerce training session‚Äôs sequence, but each time I attempted to open the advanced course, I was taken back to the home page and asked to enter my password. After three attempts, I gave up.‚Äù

I tried to find the user in our Clarity recordings and what I can say is we only see a white blank screen and a mouse moving and clicking, we don‚Äôt actually see what he sees.

This made me wonder if maybe there‚Äôs an issue with cookies being accepted that restricts some members from accessing content correctly?

You can see the recording here: <https://clarity.microsoft.com/shared/recording/561ed622-9751-45e2-9cec-33001fa58410> (expires in 2 days but can reshare later if needed).

Hey <@U059AC59LLF> regarding"Adding Courses to the Explore page results" , we had a hard problem of using 2 different category structures: WP Categories & Memberpress Course Categories. We were trying to make sure that you will add the exact same text slug on Course Categories in order to match the WP Category etc


However our devs say:
----------
The much easier way is _activating WP post Categories for Courses_ alongside Course Categories. This way, the client can simply assign relevant post categories to the courses. Also, the complexity of our work is greatly reduced.
---------

Apparetly "_activating WP post Categories for Courses_" was possible (see SS). We will go in this direction if it's OK with you.

Hey <@U059AC59LLF> I just stumbled upon a <https://www.stackedmarketer.com/pro/how-to-change-peoples-minds-and-behavior-may-2023-pro-report/|report> which behaves weirdly (second item on SS1) . You can see the live version on <https://www.stackedmarketer.com/explore/?publish_date=placeholder&categories=full-reports&search=BJ+Fogg|Explore page>.

When asked to the team, they told "This is due to custom HTML code inserted into the post excerpt (SS2), which isn't standard practice. Ideally, they should provide a brief one to two sentence description of the post."

We could have fixed this but I wanted to let you know and fix it so that you are aware of this possibility for the future.

6. Free - Data Stories (no sub-categories): <https://www.stackedmarketer.com/data-stories/>
7. Free - News (no sub-categories): <https://www.stackedmarketer.com/news/>
Can you please provide feedback based on your expectations? Am I missing any categories/groups? Would you like to organize them in any other fashion etc.

Hey <@U059AC59LLF>, as we add new sections to Learning Hub (Latest Tactics is on the table now)

I would like to discuss the structure and navigation of Learning Hub with you. Here are my topics for discussion:

‚Ä¢ Learning Hub is constantly expanding, which makes navigation harder. We already have sections for Latest Reports, you want to add the Latest Articles (Tactics) which makes sense. I would propose to 
    ‚ó¶ Make "*Featured Content*" section smaller, maybe removing the row under the line to make it lighter on brain
    ‚ó¶ Find a way not to duplicate the latest contents on "*Featured Content*" section
‚Ä¢ We have separated "*Courses You Might Like*" (top most, right after Reports) and "*Articles You Might Like*" (lower most) sections which breaks the onboarding flow. It might be better to put personalized contents in proximity (maybe under a group) for users to make sense of them.
‚Ä¢ We need to refine the Dashboard Navigation (sub-menu) based on latest decisions.

messages.text:
Hey <@U059AC59LLF>
Our friends have spotted an issue: Currently users can edit their e-mail adress on the <https://www.stackedmarketer.com/account/|Profile Page>.
However we think that e-mail should not be something that can be changed right away, due to the following reasons
‚Ä¢ E-mail is the unique identifier of an account from business perspective
‚Ä¢ Changing e-mail can cause potential issues in terms of consistency and functionality. An example is :
    ‚ó¶ When a user changes e-mail, the mail preference token created by Memberpress stays the same which causes problems on e-mails. 
RESULT: We suggest to make the e-mail field of the profile page NON EDITABLE. If an edge case happens where a user really needs to change their e-mail, they should just get in touch with support.

Ho does it sound?

RESULT: We suggest to make the e-mail field of the profile page NON EDITABLE. If an edge case happens where a user really needs to change their e-mail, they should just get in touch with support.

Ho does it sound?

Hi <@U059AC59LLF>

We've reviewed your Q4 priorities and we can deliver the first 4 priorities within the 40 hours limit.
However, to give an estimate on the other more complex ones, we would require some time to dig deeper. Here is what I propose:
We can start working on:
‚Ä¢ Learning Hub widget for "Latest Tactics"
‚Ä¢ Update navigation on learning hub
‚Ä¢ Update user guide on learning hub
‚Ä¢ Update general layout for learning hub (making it lighter on the user's brain)
And in parallel, we can also start a discovery task for one the following items:
‚Ä¢ Job Board (good integration with social profile would be nice)
‚Ä¢ Feed-based social profile / interaction module
‚Ä¢ Add gamification so users gain points for certain actions
Upon your approval on the estimates after the discovery, you and <@U46P0EG4A> can start a contract expansion discussion if necessary.

Let me know what you think about this approach. We can definitely talk about an expansion now if you think it works better.

messages.text:
Hey <@U059AC59LLF>

The team let me know they had to temporarily disable Perfmatters to fix <https://refactco.slack.com/archives/C0594LCK43H/p1748813691233639?thread_ts=1745238486.006899&cid=C0594LCK43H|the issue> with Gravity Forms redirects.

The problem is that Perfmatters tries to optimize JavaScript, but the way it‚Äôs currently set up conflicts with how Gravity Forms handles redirects. Disabling it was the quickest way to get things working again. We do recommend turning it back on once the conflict is sorted out, since it helps with site performance.

There are two ways we can move forward:
1. *Tweak Perfmatters settings*: Instead of delaying all JavaScript, we can be more selective about which files to delay. It‚Äôs a more reliable long-term fix, but would take around 4‚Äì6 hours of dev and testing to make sure everything works smoothly.
2. *Stick with the current setup*: We keep delaying all JS and try to find the specific file(s) causing the issue to exclude them. It‚Äôs faster, but there‚Äôs a higher chance of running into similar problems later.
Since we're currently out of retainer hours, I wanted to check in and see if resolving this is something you‚Äôd like to prioritize this quarter.

CC: <@UL2E9PUQP> <@U05UN1BUVCK>

elements.text: Hey
The team let me know they had to temporarily disable Perfmatters to fix
the issue

with Gravity Forms redirects.

The problem is that Perfmatters tries to optimize JavaScript, but the way it‚Äôs currently set up conflicts with how Gravity Forms handles redirects. Disabling it was the quickest way to get things working again. We do recommend turning it back on once the conflict is sorted out, since it helps with site performance.

There are two ways we can move forward:
Tweak Perfmatters settings

: Instead of delaying all JavaScript, we can be more selective about which files to delay. It‚Äôs a more reliable long-term fix, but would take around 4‚Äì6 hours of dev and testing to make sure everything works smoothly.
Stick with the current setup
: We keep delaying all JS and try to find the specific file(s) causing the issue to exclude them. It‚Äôs faster, but there‚Äôs a higher chance of running into similar problems later.

Since we're currently out of retainer hours, I wanted to check in and see if resolving this is something you‚Äôd like to prioritize this quarter.

CC:

messages.text:
Hi <@U059AC59LLF>
Quick update here.

We've implemented the recent anti-spam updates on the production site.
‚Ä¢ *Cloudflare Turnstile* is now active on all Gravity Forms (using the _managed challenge_ mode to avoid interrupting real users).
‚Ä¢ *Rate-Limiting Plugin* has been updated with a *regex-based email blocklist*.
    ‚ó¶ ‚Üí Currently, it blocks emails that start with a letter followed by more than 7 digits ‚Äî the common pattern among recent spam submissions.
‚Ä¢ *Cloudflare Managed Challenge Rule* has been applied for the *suspicious IP ranges and user agents* identified from recent spam entries.
We monitored turnstile analytics and the Cloudflare security rule in the past few days, and everything seems okay.
